change.item: Encoded in EAD by Gregory Wiedeman

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Gloria DeSole served as senior adviser to the President for Affirmative Action and Employment Planning and Director of Affirmative Action (1982-2000) at the University at Albany, SUNY before retiring in 2000. DeSole began working at the University in 1976 as associate director of the Affirmative Action Office. Prior to that she was an English professor at Skidmore College. DeSole earned bachelor's and Ph.D. degrees from the University at Albany and earned a master's degree from Columbia University. The collection includes materials related to the women's movement with an emphasis on the Capital Region of New York. DeSole collected material related to projects in Albany, speeches, and publications.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed in 2006 by Amy C. Schindler.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in 2004 and 2021 by Gloria DeSole and Meredith Butler.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Gloria DeSole served as senior adviser to the President for Affirmative Action and Employment Planning and Director of Affirmative Action (1982-2000) at the University at Albany, SUNY before retiring in 2000. DeSole began working at the University in 1976 as associate director of the Affirmative Action Office. Prior to that she was an English professor at Skidmore College. DeSole earned bachelor's and Ph.D. degrees from the University at Albany and earned a master's degree from Columbia University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes materials related to the women's movement with an emphasis on the Capital Region of New York. DeSole collected material related to projects in Albany, speeches, and publications. Records of particular interest are DeSole's speeches and the MA thesis "Feminism in the Seventies: A Study of the Womens Liberation Movement of Albany, New York, 1969-1979" by Margaret Boys of Goddard College in August 1980.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Gloria DeSole Papers, 1969-1984. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the DeSole Papers).

did.unittitle: "Feminism in the Seventies: A Study of the Womens Liberation Movement of Albany, New York, 1969-1979," Margaret Boys, MA Thesis, Goddard College
The Bitch Manifesto, by Joreen, reprint, circa 1970
